clinical_study.brief_title: Improving Treatment of Inflammatory Bowel Diseases Through Better Understanding Infliximab Drug and Antibody Levels
clinical_study.official_title: Defining and Predicting the Ideal Infliximab Pharmacokinetic Profile Associated With Treatment Efficacy in Patients With Inflammatory Bowel Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to develop a predictive model that will allow optimized dosing of infliximab for individual patients

detailed_description.textblock: The use of pharmacokinetic analyses incorporating relevant determinants of the infliximab serum concentration can be used to develop a predictive model that will allow optimized dosing for individual patients.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Unable to align the study questions with a complementary trial

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic Analysis of Infliximab in patients with moderate to severely active ulcerative colitis and Crohn's Disease
primary_outcome.description: The primary objective of this study is to define the PK profile of IFX in patients with CD and UC and to determine covariates influencing drug clearance.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quantification of relative strengths of individual determinants of infliximab pharmacokinetics
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of potential interactions between these determinants.

other_outcome.measure: Identification of patients at baseline that would benefit from receiving higher does of infliximab due to accelerated drug clearance

arm_group.description: Infliximab administered according to current FDA and EMS approved doses and intervals.

study_pop.textblock: 50 patients with Crohn's Disease and 50 patients with Ulcerative Colitis from 10 centres (Canada, United States, Netherlands and Spain).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- a diagnosis of CD or UC by usual criteria,
- moderate to severely active CD defined by a CDAI ≥ 220, with confirmed endoscopic activity (CDEIS ≥ 6) or moderate to severely active UC, defined by a Mayo Score ≥ 6, with a Mayo endoscopic subscore ≥ 2,
- a need for treatment with IFX for induction of remission as clinically indicated
- patients previously exposed to adalimumab and/or certolizumab who are naïve to infliximab will be allowed to participate.
Exclusion Criteria:
- perianal CD exclusively
- disease limited to the rectum in patients with UC (i.e., disease must extend ≥ 15 cm from the anal verge)
- patients with known antibodies to IFX (ADAs) at baseline
- a contraindication to infliximab therapy
- a contraindication to endoscopy
- an ostomy
- planned surgery
- evidence of severe or unstable hepatic, gastrointestinal, cardiovascular, respiratory, neurological, psychiatric, hematological or renal disease at the discretion of the investigator,
- Pregnancy or breastfeeding,
- treatment with any investigational drug in the past 30 days, or 5 half lives (whichever is longer).
